title: Ticket #368: Add functionality to the GC code to optionally use a tool to hibernate
description:
It has been suggested that it would be nice to be able to give Condor hints with regards to how to "hibernate" a machine. We've discovered, with some user feedback, that it can be difficult, if not impossible, to always automatically determine which "hibernation" states a particular machine can enter; further, it is also difficult to determine the tools to use in order to enter the desired "hibernation" state.

As such, it seems reasonable that an administrator could explicitly specify which "hibernation" states are supported as well as the tools required to enter these states. For instance, an administrator could approximate S5 support with shutdown.

Edit: This will be used a general framework for all hibernation capabilities in Condor. The code from the startd will be ripped out and embedded into the condor_power tool. The startd will then only be in charge of evaluating the HIBERNATE expression and passing the result to the defined hibernate command. In the general case, the command will be a script that uses condor_power to affect the state of a given machine. If the tool is exercised on the startd, the machine will likely enter hibernation; conversely, if the tool is invoked on the negotiator, it will likely wake the machine in question.
